intro.heading: Cultural Exchange with Complete Relocation Support
intro.description:
The Au Pair program in Sweden and across the EU offers a unique combination of cultural exchange and practical childcare solutions. For host families, it provides trusted childcare and light household assistance, while for au pairs it opens the door to learning new languages, integrating into Swedish culture, and experiencing life in Europe.

At Sweden Relocators, we provide complete relocation services for both host families and au pairs. From legal applications and residence permits to contract drafting, insurance, and ongoing support, our platform ensures that the process is safe, compliant, and stress-free for everyone involved.

whyFamiliesChoose.heading: Why Families in Sweden Choose Au Pairs
whyFamiliesChoose.description: Hosting an au pair is becoming increasingly popular among Swedish and EU families because it combines childcare with cultural benefits.

benefits.title: Reliable Childcare Support
benefits.description: au pairs can help with school pick-ups, homework supervision, preparing meals, and organizing activities.

benefits.title: Affordable Live-In Solution
benefits.description: compared to professional childcare services, an au pair arrangement provides cost-effective support.

benefits.title: Cultural Enrichment for Children
benefits.description: children gain exposure to new languages and cultures, broadening their worldview.

benefits.title: Support for Busy Families
benefits.description: au pairs assist with light household tasks, giving parents more time for work or personal life.

benefits.title: Flexible Arrangements
benefits.description: schedules are tailored to family needs while following legal guidelines.

whyFamiliesChoose.conclusion: Families benefit not just from practical childcare solutions, but also from the long-term cultural impact of hosting an international guest.

whyAuPairsChoose.heading: Why Young People Choose to Become Au Pairs in Sweden
whyAuPairsChoose.description: Sweden is one of the most attractive countries for au pairs due to its high standard of living, strong focus on education, and vibrant culture. For au pairs, the program offers:

benefits.title: Language Learning
benefits.description: the chance to study Swedish through language courses while living with a host family.

benefits.title: Safe and Supportive Environment
benefits.description: housing and meals provided by the host family ensure stability and comfort.

benefits.title: Cultural Integration
benefits.description: au pairs experience Swedish traditions, festivals, and everyday life.

benefits.title: Travel Opportunities
benefits.description: easy access to explore Sweden's cities and nature, as well as neighboring European countries.

benefits.title: Personal Growth
benefits.description: independence, adaptability, and new skills that improve career prospects later.

whyAuPairsChoose.conclusion: For many, an au pair stay in Sweden is both a cultural journey and a professional stepping stone.

legalFramework.heading: Legal Framework for Au Pairs in Sweden
legalFramework.description: Au pairs in Sweden are regulated under the Aliens Act (Utl√§nningslagen 2005:716), ensuring that the arrangement remains cultural exchange rather than long-term employment. Key conditions include:

requirements.title: Residence Permit
requirements.description: non-EU citizens must apply for an Au Pair Residence Permit before entering Sweden.

requirements.title: Duration
requirements.description: usually valid for up to one year, sometimes renewable.

requirements.title: Tasks Allowed
requirements.description: childcare and light household duties only, not full-scale employment.

requirements.title: Language Learning Requirement
requirements.description: au pairs are expected to attend a Swedish language course.

requirements.title: Host Family Obligations
requirements.description: provide food, accommodation, and a monthly allowance meeting Migrationsverket's minimum requirements.

legalFramework.euNote: EU/EEA citizens have a simpler process since they hold the right of residence, but still need to follow program guidelines.

contractsObligations.heading: Contracts and Obligations
contractsObligations.intro: A clear written agreement between the host family and the au pair is essential for transparency and legal compliance. At Sweden Relocators, we draft contracts that include:
items: Duties and responsibilities (childcare and household tasks).
Working hours, rest days, and holidays.
Duration of stay and renewal options.
contractsObligations.conclusion: This ensures that expectations are understood by both sides from the start, reducing the risk of conflict.

disclaimer.heading: Final Note and Disclaimer
disclaimer.note: The Au Pair program in Sweden and the EU is a rewarding opportunity for both families and young people, but it must be carefully managed within legal and cultural frameworks. At Sweden Relocators, we ensure that host families and au pairs receive complete support from the first step to the end of the program.
disclaimer.disclaimer: This information is provided for knowledge purposes only and is updated as of 23 September 2025. Rules and requirements may change. For the most accurate and official information, always check with the Swedish Migration Agency (Migrationsverket) if you are managing an au pair arrangement independently.
